messages.content: This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A travelling salesman only eats ramen and fries. Each pack of ramen contains 400 calories, 20 grams of protein, and 100 mg of sodium. Each pack of fries contains 300 calories, 10 grams of protein, and 75 mg of sodium. Since fries are easier to eat while driving, at most 30% of his meals can be ramen. The salesman wants to ensure he eats at least 3000 calories and 80 grams of protein. How many of each should he eat to minimize his sodium intake?

{ "background": "A traveling salesman consumes a diet consisting exclusively of ramen and fries, and he has nutritional targets as well as a maximum fraction of meals that can be ramen.", "constraints": [ "Number of ramen packs is non-negative", "Number of fries packs is non-negative", "At most MaxRamenFraction of the total meals can be ramen", "The salesman must eat at least MinCalories calories", "The salesman must consume at least MinProtein grams of protein" ], "objective": "Minimize the total sodium intake from the consumption of ramen and fries", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Calories contained in each pack of ramen", "symbol": "CaloriesRamen", "value": 400, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Protein contained in each pack of ramen", "symbol": "ProteinRamen", "value": 20, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Sodium contained in each pack of ramen", "symbol": "SodiumRamen", "value": 100, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Calories contained in each pack of fries", "symbol": "CaloriesFries", "value": 300, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Protein contained in each pack of fries", "symbol": "ProteinFries", "value": 10, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Sodium contained in each pack of fries", "symbol": "SodiumFries", "value": 75, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Maximum fraction of meals that can be ramen", "symbol": "MaxRamenFraction", "value": 0.3, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum total caloric intake", "symbol": "MinCalories", "value": 3000, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum total protein intake", "symbol": "MinProtein", "value": 80, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A science store makes two boxes, a cheap and expensive box. The cheap box contains 3 units of metal and 5 units of acid which can be mixed to create 8 units of foam. The expensive box contains 5 units of metal and 8 units of acid which can be mixed to create 10 units of foam. The cheap box however gives off 2 units of heat while the expensive box gives off 3 units of heat. The science store has available 200 units of metal and 300 units of acid. If at most 50 units of heat can be given off, how many of each box should the store make to maximize the amount of foam produced?

{ "background": "A science store produces two types of boxes, cheap and expensive, which require metal and acid to create foam. Both types of boxes emit heat during production.", "constraints": [ "Number of cheap boxes is non-negative", "Number of expensive boxes is non-negative", "Metal used for cheap boxes plus metal used for expensive boxes is less than or equal to MetalTotal", "Acid used for cheap boxes plus acid used for expensive boxes is less than or equal to AcidTotal", "Heat from cheap boxes plus heat from expensive boxes is less than or equal to HeatMax" ], "objective": "Maximize the amount of foam produced from manufacturing cheap and expensive boxes", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Units of metal required for a cheap box", "symbol": "MetalCheap", "value": 3, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of acid required for a cheap box", "symbol": "AcidCheap", "value": 5, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of foam produced by a cheap box", "symbol": "FoamCheap", "value": 8, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of metal required for an expensive box", "symbol": "MetalExpensive", "value": 5, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of acid required for an expensive box", "symbol": "AcidExpensive", "value": 8, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of foam produced by an expensive box", "symbol": "FoamExpensive", "value": 10, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Heat given off by a cheap box", "symbol": "HeatCheap", "value": 2, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Heat given off by an expensive box", "symbol": "HeatExpensive", "value": 3, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Total units of metal available", "symbol": "MetalTotal", "value": 200, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Total units of acid available", "symbol": "AcidTotal", "value": 300, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Maximum heat units allowed", "symbol": "HeatMax", "value": 50, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A pharmacy has 3000 mg of morphine to make painkillers and sleeping pills. Each painkiller pill requires 10 mg of morphine and 3 units of digestive medicine. Each sleeping pill requires 6 mg of morphine and 5 units of digestive medicine. The pharmacy needs to make at least 50 painkiller pills. Since sleeping pills are more popular, at least 70% of the pills should be sleeping pills. How many of each should the pharmacy make to minimize the total amount of digestive medicine needed?

{ "background": "A pharmacy has a limited amount of morphine to produce painkillers and sleeping pills, both of which require morphine and digestive medicine. The objective is to minimize the total amount of digestive medicine used while adhering to pill production requirements.", "constraints": [ "Total morphine used is less than or equal to TotalMorphine mg", "At least MinPainkillers painkiller pills must be produced", "At least MinProportionSleepingPills of the total pills produced should be sleeping pills", "Number of painkiller pills is non-negative", "Number of sleeping pills is non-negative" ], "objective": "Minimize the total amount of digestive medicine used in pill production", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Total amount of morphine available", "symbol": "TotalMorphine", "value": 3000, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Amount of morphine required to make one painkiller pill", "symbol": "MorphinePainkiller", "value": 10, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Amount of morphine required to make one sleeping pill", "symbol": "MorphineSleepingPill", "value": 6, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of digestive medicine required to make one painkiller pill", "symbol": "DigestiveMedicinePainkiller", "value": 3, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of digestive medicine required to make one sleeping pill", "symbol": "DigestiveMedicineSleepingPill", "value": 5, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum number of painkiller pills required", "symbol": "MinPainkillers", "value": 50, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum proportion of the total pills that must be sleeping pills", "symbol": "MinProportionSleepingPills", "value": 0.7, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A boy needs to get enough magnesium and zinc in his diet by eating chewable gummies and taking pills. Each gummy contains 3 units of magnesium and 4 units of zinc. Each pill contains 2 units of magnesium and 5 units of zinc. The boy must take at least 10 pills. Since he prefers gummies more, he must eat at least 3 times the amount of gummies as pills. If the boy can consume at most 200 units of magnesium, how many of each should he eat to maximize his zinc intake?

{ "background": "A boy is trying to meet his dietary requirements for magnesium and zinc through a combination of gummies and pills, with certain preferences and limitations on the amounts he can consume.", "constraints": [ "Number of gummies is non-negative", "Number of pills is non-negative", "Boy must take at least MinPills pills", "Boy must eat at least GummyPillRatio times the number of gummies as pills", "Total magnesium from gummies and pills is at most MaxMg units" ], "objective": "Maximize the boy's zinc intake from gummies and pills", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Units of magnesium contained in each gummy", "symbol": "MgGummy", "value": 3, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of zinc contained in each gummy", "symbol": "ZnGummy", "value": 4, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of magnesium contained in each pill", "symbol": "MgPill", "value": 2, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of zinc contained in each pill", "symbol": "ZnPill", "value": 5, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum amount of pills the boy must take", "symbol": "MinPills", "value": 10, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "The ratio of the minimum amount of gummies to pills required", "symbol": "GummyPillRatio", "value": 3, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Maximum units of magnesium the boy can consume", "symbol": "MaxMg", "value": 200, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A patient takes anxiety medication and anti-depressants one after the other. Each unit of anxiety medication takes 3 minutes to be effective while each unit of anti-depressant takes 5 minutes to be effective. The patient must take at least 100 units of medication and at least 30 should be anxiety medication. Since the anxiety medication is strong, the patient can take at most twice the amount of anxiety medication as anti-depressants. How many units of each should the patient take to minimize the total time it take for the medication to be effective?

{ "background": "A patient requires a combination of anxiety medication and anti-depressants with different effectiveness durations, subject to specific quantity requirements and ratio limits.", "constraints": [ "Total units of medication is at least MinUnits", "Anxiety medication units is at least MinAnxiety", "Anxiety medication units is at most MaxAnxietyAntiDepressantRatio times the anti-depressant units", "Number of anxiety medication units is non-negative", "Number of anti-depressant units is non-negative" ], "objective": "Minimize the total time for the medication to be effective", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Time for anxiety medication to be effective", "symbol": "TAnxiety", "value": 3, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Time for anti-depressant to be effective", "symbol": "TAntiDepressant", "value": 5, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum total units of medication required", "symbol": "MinUnits", "value": 100, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum units of anxiety medication required", "symbol": "MinAnxiety", "value": 30, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Maximum ratio of anxiety medication units to anti-depressant units", "symbol": "MaxAnxietyAntiDepressantRatio", "value": 2, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A pharmacy makes eye cream and foot cream using two different machines, machine 1 and machine 2. Machine 1 can make 30 ml of eye cream and 60 ml of foot cream per hour. Machine 2 can make 45 ml of eye cream and 30 ml of foot cream per hour. Furthermore, machine 1 requires 20 ml of distilled water per hour while machine 2 requires 15 ml of distilled water per hour. The pharmacy has available 1200 ml of distilled water. If the pharmacy needs to make at least 1300 ml of eye cream and 1500 ml of foot cream, how many hours should each machine be used to minimize the total time needed?

{ "background": "A pharmacy manufactures eye cream and foot cream using two machines with specific production capabilities and distilled water requirements. The goal is to minimize the total production time while meeting minimum cream production requirements.", "constraints": [ "At least MinEyeCream ml of eye cream must be produced", "At least MinFootCream ml of foot cream must be produced", "Time spent on Machine 1 is non-negative", "Time spent on Machine 2 is non-negative" ], "objective": "Minimize the total time spent using machines 1 and 2", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Amount of eye cream produced by machine 1 per hour", "symbol": "EyeMachine1", "value": 30, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Amount of foot cream produced by machine 1 per hour", "symbol": "FootMachine1", "value": 60, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Amount of eye cream produced by machine 2 per hour", "symbol": "EyeMachine2", "value": 45, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Amount of foot cream produced by machine 2 per hour", "symbol": "FootMachine2", "value": 30, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Amount of distilled water required by machine 1 per hour", "symbol": "WaterMachine1", "value": 20, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Amount of distilled water required by machine 2 per hour", "symbol": "WaterMachine2", "value": 15, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Total amount of distilled water available", "symbol": "TotalWater", "value": 1200, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum required amount of eye cream to be produced", "symbol": "MinEyeCream", "value": 1300, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum required amount of foot cream to be produced", "symbol": "MinFootCream", "value": 1500, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A woman eats cashews and almonds to get her calorie and protein intake. A serving of almonds contains 200 calories and 20 grams of protein. A serving of cashews contains 300 calories and 25 grams of protein. The woman decides to eat at least twice as many servings of almonds as cashews. Furthermore, a serving of almonds contains 15 grams of fat while a serving of cashews contains 12 grams of fat. If the woman needs to consume at least 10000 calories and 800 grams of protein this week, how many servings of each should she eat to minimize her fat intake?

{ "background": "A woman requires a certain number of calories and protein in her diet, which she obtains from servings of almonds and cashews, each with known nutritional content.", "constraints": [ "Number of servings of almonds is non-negative", "Number of servings of cashews is non-negative", "Number of servings of almonds must be at least twice the number of servings of cashews", "Total calorie intake must be at least MinCalories", "Total protein intake must be at least MinProtein" ], "objective": "Minimize the total fat intake from servings of almonds and cashews", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Calories per serving of almonds", "symbol": "CaloriesAlmonds", "value": 200, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Protein per serving of almonds", "symbol": "ProteinAlmonds", "value": 20, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Calories per serving of cashews", "symbol": "CaloriesCashews", "value": 300, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Protein per serving of cashews", "symbol": "ProteinCashews", "value": 25, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Fat per serving of almonds", "symbol": "FatAlmonds", "value": 15, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Fat per serving of cashews", "symbol": "FatCashews", "value": 12, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum total calories required", "symbol": "MinCalories", "value": 10000, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum total protein required", "symbol": "MinProtein", "value": 800, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A company make both liquid and foam hand sanitizer. Liquid hand sanitizer requires 40 units of water and 50 units of alcohol. Foam hand sanitizer requires 60 units of water and 40 units of alcohol. The company has available 2000 units of water and 2100 units of alcohol. The number of foam hand sanitizers made must exceed the number of liquid hand sanitizers. In addition, at most 30 liquid hand sanitizers can be made. If each liquid hand sanitizer can clean 30 hands and each foam hand sanitizer can clean 20 hands, how many of each should the company make to maximize the number of hands that can be cleaned?

{ "background": "A company produces liquid and foam hand sanitizers, each requiring different quantities of water and alcohol, under resource constraints and a production preference.", "constraints": [ "Number of liquid hand sanitizers is non-negative", "Number of foam hand sanitizers is non-negative", "Total water used in liquid hand sanitizers is at most WaterTotal", "Total alcohol used in liquid hand sanitizers is at most AlcoholTotal", "The number of foam hand sanitizers must exceed the number of liquid hand sanitizers", "Up to MaxLiquid liquid hand sanitizers can be made" ], "objective": "Maximize the total number of hands cleaned by the produced hand sanitizers", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Units of water required to make one unit of liquid hand sanitizer", "symbol": "WaterL", "value": 40, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of alcohol required to make one unit of liquid hand sanitizer", "symbol": "AlcoholL", "value": 50, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of water required to make one unit of foam hand sanitizer", "symbol": "WaterF", "value": 60, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of alcohol required to make one unit of foam hand sanitizer", "symbol": "AlcoholF", "value": 40, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Total units of water available", "symbol": "WaterTotal", "value": 2000, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Total units of alcohol available", "symbol": "AlcoholTotal", "value": 2100, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Maximum number of liquid hand sanitizers that can be produced", "symbol": "MaxLiquid", "value": 30, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Number of hands that can be cleaned by one unit of liquid hand sanitizer", "symbol": "CleanHandsL", "value": 30, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Number of hands that can be cleaned by one unit of foam hand sanitizer", "symbol": "CleanHandsF", "value": 20, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A clinic is conducting a throat or nasal swabs on each patient. A throat swab takes 5 minutes while a nasal swab takes 3 minutes. The clinic must administer at least 30 nasal swabs. Since the nasal swab is more uncomfortable, at least 4 times as many throat swabs must be done as nasal swabs. If the clinic is only operational for 20000 minutes, how many of each swab should be done to maximize the number of patients seen?

{ "background": "A clinic conducts throat or nasal swabs on patients with limited time and specific requirements for the minimum number of nasal swabs and the ratio between throat and nasal swabs.", "constraints": [ "Time for throat swabs is non-negative", "Time for nasal swabs is non-negative", "At least MinNasalSwabs nasal swabs must be administered", "At least ThroatNasalRatio times as many throat swabs as nasal swabs must be done", "The total time for administering both types of swabs cannot exceed TotalTime minutes" ], "objective": "Maximize the number of patients seen by determining the number of each type of swab to perform", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Time taken for one throat swab", "symbol": "ThroatSwabTime", "value": 5, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Time taken for one nasal swab", "symbol": "NasalSwabTime", "value": 3, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum number of nasal swabs to be administered", "symbol": "MinNasalSwabs", "value": 30, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum ratio of throat swabs to nasal swabs", "symbol": "ThroatNasalRatio", "value": 4, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Total operational time in minutes", "symbol": "TotalTime", "value": 20000, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A patient in the hospital can take two different pain killers, pain killer 1 and pain killer 2. Per dose, pain killer 1 delivers 0.5 units of medicine to the legs and 0.8 units of medicine to the back. Per dose, pain killer 2 delivers 0.7 units of medicine to the legs and 0.4 units of medicine to the back. In, addition pain killer 1 deliver 0.3 units of sleeping medicine and pain killer 2 delivers 0.6 units of sleeping medicine. At most 8 units of sleep medicine should be delivered and at least 4 units of medicine should be delivered to the legs. How many doses of each should be taken to maximize the amount of medicine delivered to the back?

{ "background": "A hospital patient needs medication, with the option to take two different pain killers. Each pain killer contributes different amounts of medicine to various parts of the body and includes a sleep medicine component.", "constraints": [ "Number of doses of pain killer 1 is non-negative", "Number of doses of pain killer 2 is non-negative", "Total amount of sleep medicine from both pain killers is at most MaxSleepMedicine units", "Total amount of leg medicine from both pain killers is at least MinLegMedicine units" ], "objective": "Maximize the total amount of medicine delivered to the back", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Amount of leg medicine per dose of pain killer 1", "symbol": "LegMedicinePainKiller1", "value": 0.5, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Amount of back medicine per dose of pain killer 1", "symbol": "BackMedicinePainKiller1", "value": 0.8, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Amount of leg medicine per dose of pain killer 2", "symbol": "LegMedicinePainKiller2", "value": 0.7, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Amount of back medicine per dose of pain killer 2", "symbol": "BackMedicinePainKiller2", "value": 0.4, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Amount of sleep medicine per dose of pain killer 1", "symbol": "SleepMedicinePainKiller1", "value": 0.3, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Amount of sleep medicine per dose of pain killer 2", "symbol": "SleepMedicinePainKiller2", "value": 0.6, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Maximum units of sleep medicine allowed", "symbol": "MaxSleepMedicine", "value": 8, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum units of leg medicine required", "symbol": "MinLegMedicine", "value": 4, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A zookeeper feeds a gorilla with bananas and mangoes. Each banana contains 80 calories, 20 grams of potassium, and 10 grams of sugar. Each mango contains 100 calories, 15 grams of potassium, and 8 grams of sugar. The gorilla must consume at least 4000 calories and 150 grams of potassium. Since the gorilla prefers bananas, at most 33% of the fruits he eats can be mangoes. If excess sugar makes the gorilla aggressive, how many of each fruit should he consume to minimize his sugar intake?

{ "background": "A zookeeper needs to optimize the diet of a gorilla to meet nutritional requirements while minimizing sugar intake and respecting the gorilla's preference for bananas.", "constraints": [ "Number of bananas is non-negative", "Number of mangoes is non-negative", "Gorilla must consume at least MinCalories calories", "Gorilla must consume at least MinPotassium grams of potassium", "At most MaxMangoPercentage of the fruits can be mangoes" ], "objective": "Minimize the gorilla's sugar intake from the bananas and mangoes", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Calories in one banana", "symbol": "BananaCalories", "value": 80, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Grams of potassium in one banana", "symbol": "BananaPotassium", "value": 20, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Grams of sugar in one banana", "symbol": "BananaSugar", "value": 10, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Calories in one mango", "symbol": "MangoCalories", "value": 100, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Grams of potassium in one mango", "symbol": "MangoPotassium", "value": 15, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Grams of sugar in one mango", "symbol": "MangoSugar", "value": 8, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum total calories the gorilla must consume", "symbol": "MinCalories", "value": 4000, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum total grams of potassium the gorilla must consume", "symbol": "MinPotassium", "value": 150, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Maximum percentage of mangoes in the gorilla's diet", "symbol": "MaxMangoPercentage", "value": 0.33, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

In a science club, there are two tables that can be set up to make slime. At table 1, 3 units of powder and 5 units of glue are used to make 4 units of slime. At table 2, 8 units of powder and 6 units of glue are used to make 5 units of slime. However, table 1 produces 2 units of mess while table 2 produces 4 units of mess. The science club has available 100 units of powder and 90 units of glue. If at most 30 units of mess can be made, how many of each table should be set up to maximize the amount of slime produced?

{ "background": "A science club has two tables for making slime, each using different quantities of powder and glue and producing different amounts of slime and mess. There is a limited supply of powder, glue, and a maximum mess tolerance.", "constraints": [ "Number of Table 1 setups is non-negative", "Number of Table 2 setups is non-negative", "Total quantity of powder used by Table 1 and Table 2 does not exceed TotalPowder", "Total quantity of glue used by Table 1 and Table 2 does not exceed TotalGlue", "Total mess produced by Table 1 and Table 2 setups does not exceed MaxMess" ], "objective": "Maximize the total amount of slime produced by both tables", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Units of powder used at table 1", "symbol": "Powder1", "value": 3, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of glue used at table 1", "symbol": "Glue1", "value": 5, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of slime produced at table 1", "symbol": "Slime1", "value": 4, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of powder used at table 2", "symbol": "Powder2", "value": 8, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of glue used at table 2", "symbol": "Glue2", "value": 6, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of slime produced at table 2", "symbol": "Slime2", "value": 5, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of mess produced at table 1", "symbol": "Mess1", "value": 2, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of mess produced at table 2", "symbol": "Mess2", "value": 4, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Total available units of powder", "symbol": "TotalPowder", "value": 100, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Total available units of glue", "symbol": "TotalGlue", "value": 90, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Maximum allowable units of mess", "symbol": "MaxMess", "value": 30, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A pharmaceutical company has 800 units of painkiller medicine and makes daytime and nighttime painkiller. A daytime pill has 6 units of painkiller medicine and 2 units of sleep medicine. A nighttime pill has 5 units of painkiller medicine and 5 units of sleep medicine. Since some people don’t want the sleeping effect, at least 40% of the pills must be daytime pills. However at least 200 nighttime pills must be made. How many of each pill should be made to minimize the total amount of sleep medicine required?

{ "background": "A pharmaceutical company is producing daytime and nighttime painkiller pills, both containing painkiller medicine, with nighttime pills also containing sleep medicine. There are limited resources for producing these pills, and certain minimum production requirements must be met.", "constraints": [ "Total units of painkiller medicine used cannot exceed TotalPainkillerUnits", "At least MinimumDaytimePercentage % of the total number of pills must be daytime pills", "At least MinimumNighttimePills nighttime pills must be made", "Number of daytime pills is non-negative", "Number of nighttime pills is non-negative" ], "objective": "Minimize the total amount of sleep medicine used in the pills", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Total units of painkiller medicine available", "symbol": "TotalPainkillerUnits", "value": 800, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of painkiller medicine per daytime pill", "symbol": "DaytimePainkillerUnits", "value": 6, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of sleep medicine per daytime pill", "symbol": "DaytimeSleepUnits", "value": 2, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of painkiller medicine per nighttime pill", "symbol": "NighttimePainkillerUnits", "value": 5, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Units of sleep medicine per nighttime pill", "symbol": "NighttimeSleepUnits", "value": 5, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum percentage of pills that must be daytime pills", "symbol": "MinimumDaytimePercentage", "value": 0.4, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum number of nighttime pills required", "symbol": "MinimumNighttimePills", "value": 200, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A competitive eater challenges himself to eat slices of cheesecake and caramel cake. Each slice of cheesecake contains 200 calories and 40 grams of sugar. Each slice of caramel cake contains 250 calories and 50 grams of sugar. He prefers cheesecake and decides to eat at least 3 times as many slices of cheesecake as caramel cake. However, he must also eat at least 3 slices of caramel cake. If he can consume at most 10000 calories in one day, how many slices of each cake should he eat to maximize the total amount of sugar he consumes?

{ "background": "A competitive eater aims to consume slices of cheesecake and caramel cake under certain dietary constraints while maximizing sugar intake.", "constraints": [ "Number of cheesecake slices is non-negative", "Number of caramel cake slices is non-negative", "Number of cheesecake slices is at least CheeseCaramelRatio times the number of caramel cake slices", "At least MinCaramel slices of caramel cake must be eaten", "Total calorie intake from all slices must not exceed MaxCalories" ], "objective": "Maximize the total amount of sugar consumed from both cheesecake and caramel cake slices", "parameters": [ { "definition": "Calories per slice of cheesecake", "symbol": "CalCheesecake", "value": 200, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Grams of sugar per slice of cheesecake", "symbol": "SugarCheesecake", "value": 40, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Calories per slice of caramel cake", "symbol": "CalCaramelCake", "value": 250, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Grams of sugar per slice of caramel cake", "symbol": "SugarCaramelCake", "value": 50, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum ratio of cheesecake slices to caramel cake slices", "symbol": "CheeseCaramelRatio", "value": 3, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Minimum number of caramel cake slices to be eaten", "symbol": "MinCaramel", "value": 3, "shape": [] }, { "definition": "Maximum calorie intake", "symbol": "MaxCalories", "value": 10000, "shape": [] } ] }
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

Both sulfate and ginger need to be added to a shampoo. One unit of sulfate takes 0.5 minutes to be effective while one unit of ginger takes 0.75 minutes to be effective. The shampoo must contain at least 100 units of sulfates and a total of 400 units of both ingredient. Since too much sulfate can damage the hair, there can be at most twice the amount of sulfate as ginger in the shampoo. How many units of each should be added to the shampoo to minimize the total amount of time it takes for the mixture to be effective? (Note: one must be added before the other)
